page.title: 20TRENCH FARM HILDENBOROUGH
page.content: Geoffrey Brooks inherited Trench Farm from his grandfather in 1960,having lived there all his life.He owns 310 acres of grade 3 land producing winter wheat,barley and beans.There is also grassland for silage and hay with grazing for 120 sheep and 50 bullocks. Trench Farm existed before 1860 and some of its hedges are known to be very ancient.There has been a farm there for over 600 years and Mr.Brooks believes that there was a Roman sett_ lement near Hilden Brook which divides his land. Over the past 20 years farm_ ing here has become more machinery in_ tensive. The land was originally used for raising hops,but this was given up in 1967 when the Oast became defunct. These buildings are now the Oast Theatre.Mr.Brooks now sees the farm_ er's main problems as politicians, children and birds,in that order.
